content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

content.user_instructions:

SG Maths Tuition

    Maths Tuition by Ph.D. holder

    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one and Small Group classes
    • Personalised lesson plans
    • University, JC, E/A maths
    • Latest MOE Syllabus + IP + IB
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    About The Tutor

    Greetings! This is Dr Ng, a dedicated private tutor in Singapore, specializing in Mathematics for Junior College and Upper Secondary, as well as Mathematics and Statistics at the University level.

    I strive to create a learning environment that is both enjoyable and enriching, ensuring that every student has a fulfilling educational experience.

    More than 80 percent of my students have seen at least a two grade improvement after just a few months of tuition. Many have achieved distinctions in their final examinations.

    Academic Qualifications

    • Ph.D (Mathematics) from National University of Singapore
    • B.Sc. (Honours - First Class) from National University of Singapore

    Experience

    • Full time tutor since 2010
    • Both tuition centre and home-based
    • Well-versed with latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus

    Various Levels Taught

    University Maths

    Mathematics at University and Polytechnic level is extremely broad in scope. I cover Probability & Statistics, Calculus of Several Variables, Linear Algebra, Analysis, Abstract Algebra, and Discrete Mathematics for Year 1 and 2.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Junior College Maths

    Junior College (JC) Mathematics is where I have the most extensive experience. I provide focused tracks for H2/H1 Mathematics, H3 Mathematics, and H2 Further Mathematics -- all latest MOE syllabus.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Secondary Level

    I tutor both Elementary Maths and Additional Maths for G3 and G2 students (latest MOE syllabus) and also provide coverage for Integrated Programme (IP).

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Testimonials

content.text: {"queries": ["hero section CSS height image object-fit cover --QDF=5", "class=\"hero\" picture hero-media --QDF=5", "hero-media img object-fit cover height 100% --QDF=5"], "source_filter": ["files_uploaded_in_conversation"]}

thoughts.content: To make the hero image fill the height of the hero section regardless of screen size, I think you could set the image as a background with `background-size: cover;` on the `.hero` class. Since the padding and margins shouldn’t change, you can adjust the image's size dynamically without affecting layout.

The issue is that the inline style on the `` tag forces the height to auto, which overrides the `.hero .hero-media img { height: 100%; }` rule. To fix this, you can either remove the inline height or use `height: 100% !important;` in the CSS to ensure it takes priority over the inline style.

thoughts.summary: CSS solution for responsive hero image
thoughts.content: To fix the issue of the inline height overriding the CSS, add `height: 100% !important;` to `.hero .hero-media img`. This will ensure the image fills the hero section's height regardless of screen size. Enjoy the automatic cropping with `object-fit: cover;` Keep the fixed height for the `.hero` class with your existing height and min-height constraints.

thoughts.summary: Finalizing solution for hero image fill
thoughts.content: So, I’ll keep the `object-fit: cover;` and add `height: 100% !important;` to `.hero .hero-media img` to override the inline style. I won’t change padding or margins, and for full hero section height (but not full viewport), I can leave `min-height` as it is. Additionally, setting the `<picture>` to `display: block; height: 100%` ensures it behaves properly.

thoughts.summary: CSS solution for hero image fill
